Jonny_Diaz:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{for|the American journalist|Johnny Diaz}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jonny Diaz | image = Jonny Diaz September 2008.jpg | caption = Diaz performing in 2008 | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Jonathan Adam Diaz | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1984|3|30}} | death_date = | origin = Florida | instrument = | genre = [[Contemporary Christian music|CCM]], [[pop music|pop]], [[Country music|country]]{{Citation needed|date=September 2014}} | occupation = Singer/songwriter | years_active = 2003–present | label = [[Fair Trade Services|INO]], [[Centricity Music|Centricity]] | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|jonnydiaz.com/}} }} '''Jonathan Adam "Jonny" Diaz''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|d|aɪ|.|æ|z}} {{respell|DEYE|az}}) (born March 30, 1984){{cite web|url=https://www.twitter.com/jonnydiaz|title=Jonny Diaz (jonnydiaz) on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=September 27, 2014}} is an American [[Contemporary Christian music|contemporary Christian]] pop artist originally from [[Lakeland, Florida]]. His song "More Beautiful You" has charted on American Christian music charts. His major record label debut album of the same name has charted on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' magazine's [[Top Heatseekers]] and [[Top Christian Albums]] charts. == Career == Diaz released his first album ''Shades of White'' in August 2003 right before he began his second year of college; his second album, ''Everyday God'', was released during his fourth year of college. He collaborated with producer Mitch Dane on his third CD ''They Need Love'' and the project came out in March 2007. That album included the song "Hold Me", which got him attention when the song placed on the Top 40 charts.{{cite web|url=http://www.newmanmag.com/e-magazine/051809/story6.php|title=Music Review: Jonny Diaz|last=DeVore|first=Leigh|date=May 18, 2009|publisher=New Man Magazine|accessdate=July 31, 2009}} Diaz's major label debut album ''More Beautiful You'' album has appeared on several [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] magazine charts; on July 25, 2009 it was ranked No. 32 on the [[Top Christian Albums]] chart and No. 25 on the [[Top Heatseekers]] chart.{{cite magazine|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=jonny diaz|chart=all}}|title= More Beautiful You (2009) |date=July 25, 2009|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|accessdate=July 31, 2009}} The album's [[lead single]] "More Beautiful You" hit the American charts in mid-2009 and reached No. 2 on ''Billboard'''s [[Hot Christian Songs]] chart by the end of August 2009.{{cite magazine |url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=jonny diaz|chart=all}} |title=Jonny Diaz Music News & Info|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|accessdate=August 29, 2009}} The song tells young women that they are beautiful the way they are. Diaz said "I hope to get the attention of females and tell them the truth found in God's Word, that there could never be a more beautiful you." His music career was essentially started by leading worship for the youth group of the First Presbyterian Church in Lakeland, FL, playing with Brett Blondell and Vanessa Barbee. == Sound == Jesus Freak Hideout says his style "nearly echoes the sound of [[Jason Mraz]]". Christian Manifesto says "Armed with a guitar and a clear message, his music is easily identifiable as that 'safe' genre 'acoustic pop'. But, at least, it is stellar acoustic pop, this time." His sound has been compared to [[Dave Barnes]], [[Bebo Norman]],{{cite web|url=http://www.ccmmagazine.com/reviews/music/11605983/|title=Promising Artist Dallies with Forgettable Fare|last=Cartwright|first=Grace S.|publisher=CCM Magazine|accessdate=July 31, 2009}} [[John Mayer]], and [[Brandon Heath]].{{cite web|url=http://thechristianmanifesto.wordpress.com/2009/06/22/johnny-diazs-more-beautiful-you-a-review/|title=Johnny Diaz's "More Beautiful You": A Review|last=Akinola|first=Lydia|date=May 1, 2009|publisher=The Christian Manifesto|accessdate=July 31, 2009}}{{Dead link|date=March 2023 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} == Touring == Diaz has appeared as an opening act for [[Building 429]], [[Steven Curtis Chapman]], [[MercyMe]], [[Bebo Norman]], and [[Shane & Shane]]. He has performed at several Christian music festivals such as the [[Alive Festival]] and Atlanta Fest. On his official website, he announce that he will be touring with [[Matthew West]] on the "Story of Your Life Tour". ==Personal life== After graduating from high school, Diaz was offered a full [[athletic scholarship]] to play baseball for [[Florida State University]].{{cite web|url=http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/cdreviews/MoreBeautifulYou.asp|title=Jonny Diaz: More Beautiful You|last=Leisure|first=Logan|date=May 2, 2009|publisher=Jesus Freak Hideout|accessdate=July 31, 2009}} Diaz was the fourth of four brothers to get a college baseball scholarship. His brother, [[Matt Diaz]] was a professional baseball player in the major leagues, and another one of his brothers played baseball professionally. He started college in the second half of 2002{{cite web|url=http://www.cbn.com/cbnmusic/artists/Diaz_Jonny.aspx|title=Jonny Diaz Bio|publisher=[[Christian Broadcasting Network]]|accessdate=July 31, 2009}} and played on the team for one year.{{cite web|url=http://www.christianitytoday.com/music/reviews/2009/morebeautifulyou-mini.html|title=Jonny Diaz: More Beautiful You |last=Greer|first=Andrew|date=May 2009|publisher=Christian Music Today|accessdate=July 31, 2009}} According to Jesus Freak Hideout, he "felt God calling him to pursue music". == Discography == === Full-length albums === * 2003: ''Shades of White'' (Independent) * 2005: ''Everyday God'' (Independent) * 2007: ''They Need Love'' (Independent){{cite web|url=http://www.christianitytoday.com/music/reviews/2007/theyneedlove.html|title=Jonny Diaz: They Need Love|last=Banistar|first=Christa|publisher=Christian Music Today|accessdate=July 31, 2009}} * 2009: ''[[More Beautiful You]]'' (INO) * 2011: ''Jonny Diaz'' (INO) * 2014: ''[[Let It Fly (Jonny Diaz album)|Let It Fly]]'' (Centricity) === EPs === * 2008: ''Come, Let Us Adore'' (Independent) * 2015: ''[[Everything Is Changing (EP)|Everything Is Changing]]'' * 2018: ''Sweetness & Sorrow'' * 2020: ''Hear That Story'' === Singles === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2"| Single ! colspan="3"| Chart positions ! rowspan="2" |[[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]] ! rowspan="2" | Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Hot Christian Songs|US
